keyPolicies.policyDescription: With a starting rate for income tax of £10,000. Helping working people on low to middle level incomes.
The 'Pupil Premium'. Cutting class sizes, recruiting more teachers, and providing one to one tuition for those who are struggling.
Taking advantage of the need for new green technologies, by beating at the centre of clean-tech, making British inventiveness work harder.
Changing the voting system, bringing back trust and giving local councils and communities more control over what happens in their own areas.

issues.economy: A sustainable economy - Taking advantage of the need for new green technologies, by beating at the centre of clean-tech, making British inventiveness work harder.
issues.education: A fair start for children - The 'Pupil Premium'. Cutting class sizes, recruiting more teachers, and providing one to one tuition for those who are struggling.
issues.governance: Transforming politics - Changing the voting system, bringing back trust and giving local councils and communities more control over what happens in their own areas.

leaflet.personalStatement: Brian Mathew has a background as a humanitarian aid worker and engineer. He has been posted to a number of the world's troublespots and wants to do his bit for Britain.

politicalExperience.achievements: Served with WaterAid and CESVI, as well as with the British Government's DFID Programme in Zimbabwe.

endorsements.endorsement: Seen at the 'Wave climate change rally' with Brian Mathew.

images.caption: Nick Clegg & Brian Mathew at the Wave climate change rally
